ModelUnit.modelid: .SnowWet (water in liquid state in the snow cover calculation)
ModelUnit.name: SnowWet (water in liquid state in the snow cover calculation)

Description.Title: SnowWet (water in liquid state in the snow cover calculation)
Description.Institution: INRA (Institut National de la Recherche Agronomique), France
Description.ExtendedDescription: Computes the daily liquid water content in the snowpack (Swet). If refreezing (Mrf) does not exceed the previous day's liquid water (Swet_t1), a provisional value is calculated as Swet_t1 + precip − Snowaccu + M − Mrf, and then capped at 10% of the solid snow water content (0.1 × Sdry). If Mrf > Swet_t1, Swet is set to 0. The component represents a simple water balance with a structural limit on liquid retention in the snowpack.
Description.ShortDescription: Daily update of liquid water in the snowpack constrained to 10% of solid snow, accounting for precipitation, snowfall, melt, and refreezing.

Input.name: Swet_t1
Input.description: Water in liquid state in the snow cover in previous day

Input.name: Mrf
Input.description: Liquid water in the snow cover in the process of refreezing

Input.name: M
Input.description: Snow in the process of melting

Input.name: Sdry
Input.description: Water in solid state in the snow cover

Output.name: Swet
Output.description: Water in liquid state in the snow cover
